rows.translation: When the Imminent [Hour] befalls

bismillah.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.

rows.translation: —there is no denying that it will befall—
[it will be] lowering and exalting.
When the earth is shaken violently,
and the mountains are shattered into bits
and become scattered dust,
you will be three groups:
The People of the Right Hand—and what are the People of the Right Hand?!
And the People of the Left Hand—and what are the People of the Left Hand?!
And the Foremost Ones are the foremost ones:
they are the ones brought near [to Allah],
[who will reside] in the gardens of bliss.
A multitude from the former [generations]
and a few from the latter ones.
On brocaded couches
reclining on them, face to face.
They will be waited upon by immortal youths,
with goblets and ewers and a cup of a clear wine,
which causes them neither headache nor stupefaction,
and such fruits as they prefer
and such flesh of fowls as they desire,
and big-eyed houris
like guarded pearls,
a reward for what they used to do.

rows.arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
rows.translation: They will not hear therein any vain talk or sinful speech,
rows.transliteration: lā yasma`ūna fīhā laghwan walā ta-thīmā

rows.translation: but only the watchword, ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’
And the People of the Right Hand—what are the People of the Right Hand?!
Amid thornless lote trees
and clustered spathes
and extended shade,
and ever-flowing water
and abundant fruits,
neither inaccessible, nor forbidden,
and noble spouses.
We have created them with a special creation,
and made them virgins,
loving, of a like age,
for the People of the Right Hand.
A multitude from the former [generations]
and a multitude from the latter [ones].
And the People of the Left Hand—what are the People of the Left Hand?!
Amid infernal miasma and boiling water
and the shadow of a dense black smoke,
neither cool nor beneficial.
Indeed they had been affluent before this,
and they used to persist in the great sin.

rows.arabic: وَكَانُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
rows.translation: And they used to say, ‘What! When we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?!
rows.transliteration: wakānū yaqūlūna a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

rows.translation: And our forefathers too?!’
Say, ‘Indeed the former and latter generations
will all be gathered for the tryst of a known day.
Then indeed, you, astray deniers,
will surely eat from the Zaqqum tree
and stuff your bellies with it,
and drink boiling water on top of it,
drinking like thirsty camels.’
Such will be the hospitality they receive on the Day of Retribution.
We created you. Then why do you not acknowledge it?
Have you considered the sperm that you emit?
Is it you who create it, or are We the creator?

rows.arabic: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
rows.translation: We have ordained death among you, and We are not to be outmaneuvered
rows.transliteration: naḥnu qaddarnā baynakumul mawta wa mā naḥnu bimasbūqīn

rows.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَـٰلَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِى مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: from replacing you with your likes and recreating you in [a realm] you do not know.
rows.transliteration: `alā an nubaddila amthālakum wanunshi-akum fī mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Certainly you have known the first genesis, then why do you not take admonition?
Have you considered what you sow?
Is it you who make it grow, or are We the grower?

rows.arabic: لَوْ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ حُطَـٰمًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
rows.translation: If We wish, We turn it into chaff, whereat you are left stunned [saying to yourselves,]
rows.transliteration: law nashā-u laja`alnāhu ḥuṭāman faẓaltum tafakkahūn

rows.translation: ‘Indeed we have suffered loss!
No, we are deprived!’
Have you considered the water that you drink?

rows.arabic: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنزِلُونَ
rows.translation: Is it you who bring it down from the rain cloud, or is it We who bring [it] down?
rows.transliteration: a-antum anzaltumūhu minal muzni am naḥnul munzilūn

rows.arabic: لَوْ نَشَآءُ جَعَلْنَـٰهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: If We wish We can make it bitter. Then why do you not give thanks?
rows.transliteration: law nashā-u ja`alnāhu ujājan falawlā tashkurūn

rows.translation: Have you considered the fire that you kindle?

rows.arabic: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنشِـُٔونَ
rows.translation: Was it you who caused its tree to grow, or were We the grower?
rows.transliteration: a-antum ansha-tum shajaratahā am naḥnul munshi-ūn

rows.translation: It was We who made it a reminder and a boon for the desert-dwellers.
rows.transliteration: naḥnu ja`alnāhā tadhkiratan wa matā`al lil-muqwyn

rows.translation: So celebrate the Name of your Lord, the All-supreme.
I swear by the places where the stars set!
And indeed it is a great oath, should you know.
This is indeed a noble Quran,
in a guarded Book
—no one touches it except the pure ones—
sent down gradually from the Lord of all the worlds.
What! Do you take lightly this discourse?
And make your denial of it your vocation?
So when it reaches the throat [of the dying person],
and at that moment you are looking on [at his bedside]

rows.arabic: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تُبْصِرُونَ
rows.translation: —and We are nearer to him than you are, though you do not perceive—
rows.transliteration: wanaḥnu aqrabu ilayhi minkum walākin lā tubṣirūn

rows.translation: then why do you not restore it, if you are not subject
[to Divine dispensation], if you are truthful?
Then, if he be of those brought near,
then ease, abundance, and a garden of bliss.

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
rows.translation: And if he be of the People of the Right Hand,
rows.transliteration: wa-ammā in kāna min aṣ-ḥābil yamīn

rows.translation: then [he will be told,] ‘Peace be on you, from the People of the Right Hand!’

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
rows.translation: But if he be of the impugners, the astray ones,
rows.transliteration: wa-ammā in kāna minal mukadhhibīnaḍ ḍāllīn

rows.translation: then a treat of boiling water
and entry into hell.
Indeed this is certain truth.
So celebrate the Name of your Lord, the All-supreme!
